title: Understanding Rational Numbers
text: A rational number is any number that can be expressed as the quotient or fraction $$\frac{p}{q}$$ of two integers, where the denominator q is not zero.

title: Terminating vs Repeating Decimals
text: A terminating decimal has a finite number of digits after the decimal point, while a repeating decimal has one or more repeating digits or sequences of digits after the decimal point.

title: Simplifying the Fraction
text: To determine if $$\frac{15}{5}$$ is a terminating or repeating decimal, first simplify the fraction.

title: Identifying the Decimal Type
text: Once you have simplified the fraction, check if the result is a whole number. Whole numbers are considered terminating decimals.
